Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, children, let this book be pleasing to you as it fulfills the science of medicine for your satisfaction, and through its explanations, and through its declarations, in my view, I find that this treatise has been compiled for you. This part is from the operation on myself, which is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation on oneself is confined to our region and in our times entirely private, where its science faces great peril, and its traces have been left behind; it would not be possible without it except for some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which rectify many errors and misconceptions within these confines where interpretations are closed, thus extending the effort and skill required.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is seen by me that this treatise should be revived in the manner of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; and to bring forth the forms of the tools like cauteries and other work equipment as part of the explanation, and for their preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for why a good artisan cannot be found to use their own hands in this our time is that the art of medicine is long and requires expertise before being exercised in the science of anatomy which Gualia knew about the young parts of the members and their shapes, and their connection and separation; one must have knowledge of bones, nerves, and ducts, their number, and their removal; as well as pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations for their exit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And that is why Hippocrates said about his name is motion, but in the work small, and mostly in the art of hands.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	And we have already said about this in the introduction to this book; whoever does not know what we have told you about anatomy will fall into error which can lead to the death of many people, as I have seen too many like them who are formed in this science and then move on to that other field of study.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a physician who was experienced and had performed an abscess operation on the neck of a woman, and he opened several neck arteries so that there would be a great bleeding, resulting in her dying among the many others.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who was about to remove a stone from an old man, who had been suffering for his condition, and the stone was large. It successfully removed that stone using a piece of the bladder, resulting in the old man's death on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already attempted to remove it, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and because of the position of the patient beneath him causing obstruction below, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who was paid a fee by a duke from our land for surgery. He operated on a black slave who had suffered a fracture in his thigh; and with his lack of knowledge, he removed the fracture piece onto the wound, using pieces of wood and strong bands around it, not allowing air to enter the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he would let it heal according to his desires, and he would dress the wound, and he would keep it clean for several days and instruct us to remove the stitches; and this is also within when the thigh and the leg abscesses, it will lead to disaster.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I had him call me, and I prepared to remove the stitches, and thus achieved calmness and alleviation of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was confirmed in the limb, so I could not stop it, and it continued to spread the corruption within the limb as the patient's condition worsened.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who punctured an abscess and became infected over several days, during which the severity of his illness increased in front of his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is because the young person's body is full of melancholic humors, so it does not spread throughout completely, but rather that one part of their body suffers from being exposed to everything.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, children, it is necessary for you that the operation on oneself be divided into two desirous aspects: one is in operation towards health associated with it, and another in work where there are major risks.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already established this throughout all parts of this book concerning the operation where errors and fears occur; so it is necessary for you to observe this and guard against that, so as not to confuse others or yourself.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your tools for service and protection of God, and your patients for happiness and strength.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by God's grace to seek salvation and acceptable succession, and leave your terrible diseases of difficult recovery, and guard against the tools that make you afraid, knowing that more remain for your glory, and further in this world and beyond to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia had already spoken some wise teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Don't treat bad diseases with bad doctors, for it's better not to have a name than to be treated by a bad doctor."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already organized this book according to three chapters.

De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On using fire for cautery, sharp medicine, and recalling the operation procedure.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Here begins the treatise on all free subjects.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Let me tell you about the quality of those affected by this cautery and its consequences, and in which stage it is prohibited to apply cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discussion about the quality of cauterization and its consequences is long-winded and detailed, subtle in science, and hidden in secrecy; many wise men have already spoken extensively on this topic, and they disagree with each other. As for me, it's enough to mention just a small part of their speeches, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus I say that cauterization affects the entire body universally, which is made of matter or two kinds of matter, except for two conditions; these are the conditions of the tailbone.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the tailbone and in the dry condition there is only matter; some argue that cauterization should be applied to such conditions, while others argue against it, stating that cauterization is not suitable for maladies of the body which are due to quality and dryness. Since fire has qualities and promotes dryness, applying heat can cause harm by drying out what needs to heal and leaving it dry instead of restoring its health.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And the one who disagrees with you says that in every tail malady which is dry and found in men's bodies, cauterization should be done to promote its healing. When you compare the body of man to the qualities of fire, you find that the body of man is cleansed by heat.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the argument presented there, this experience was something I discovered a few times already.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not for me to delve into matters that have already been discussed in the chapter on cauterization through subsequent exercises, and I am familiar with the diversity of bodily conditions in men and the disposition of their ailments across various body parts, as well as the causes behind them, their accidents, and the timeline associated with these issues.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	For other conditions, you need not fear; especially in wet and humid ailments, all doctors have agreed on these matters, and they are not in disagreement about the use of cauterization in such conditions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and its beneficial nature lies in applying cauterizing medicine which burns. For fire is simple; its action reaches only the part being cauterized and does not affect other parts unless there's a small harm involved.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of burning medicine extends to those parts of the body it touches, and strongly promotes making difficult-to-heal injuries easier, as well as speeding up their healing process.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Fire, due to its purity and the excellence of its substance, does nothing else but remove excess. We have come to know this through experiments and from our years of service studying the art, understanding its true causes; hence I apologize for the length of my explanation. But were it not that this knowledge about fire is hidden in my manual and the quality of its operation within the body as well as its expulsion process where you expel diseases, which would be demonstrated philosophically, it would have been enlightening for your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the time when it's best to do cauterization and favor the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is suitable at any time, as the harm caused by the incidental accident gets submerged in the healing process of what results from cauterization, especially if it's for pain or necessary pains that are severe and painful ulcers, which do not tolerate delay as feared for those caused by malicious actions, which surpass minor harms occurring due to time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And rest assured in your minds, children, or those who only value the common people and laymen doctors, it's true that not all ailments treated by cauterization are suitable at all times, and they follow this principle.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not just because they are cautious about this, for cauterization is merely a form of medicine that alters body composition and dries out the humidity which causes pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, excessive cauterizations over medicine due to the value of its effectiveness and the virtue of its operation, as well as the grandeur of its lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It's possible that their ailment could return at some point in time, according to the composition of their body and the location of their illness, as well as its virtue, and what is prepared within their body from the addition of these excesses, as well as what is consumed by them through foods and similar causes; unless the ailment that receives cauterization is a subtle illness involving few excesses and humidity. Just like cauterization for tooth pain and similar cases, it's possible that this particular pain doesn't return within them anymore, but only when dealing with small matters.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common language is that a cautery is the last tool of medicine, and this term is formal, not something I understand in it, as they believe it is neither a cure nor a cause related to medicine or any other reason for a cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is opposite to this; I understand that a cautery is the last tool of medicine, not only when administering the methods of treatment in certain illnesses. If those medicines do not work and at the end of the process they apply a cautery and then proceed with it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here are the 16 points that a cautery is the last tool of medicine, not according to my understanding which includes common knowledge and many doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they would say that a cautery made of gold is better than one made of iron, and they didn't say this simply because of the equality of gold and its inferiority to the substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they would say that the place for cautery does not smell bad, as this is not absolutely true; I have already done this and found out that it doesn't do this in certain types of bodies, and a cautery made with gold is good and better than iron too, as they said. But otherwise, when you make a cautery over fire using gold, it's not like you're declaring its use, because the heat depends on the quantity you want for the strength of the gold, and what needs to be received during combustion; and if you adjust over this flame, the gold is melted by the fire, and in some cases, layers are produced so that the artisan can work with it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, when making a cautery out of iron, you should do so more lightly and more precisely in the direction of the operation.

And I have already organized this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have organized those of the head in the feet, because I am asking for what you want from them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Regarding cautery for headache due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery treatment is attributed to humidity and coldness causing the unfortunate event of which there are two causes, they are due to excess of water and trauma from fluid movement, called gushes, from the head to the parts of the ears and the ear canals, and from sleeping, and toothache and tonsillitis, and universally for any illness that comes from coldness, such as paralytic illnesses, edema and apoplexy, and resembling those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery treatment is as follows, which we initially command the patient to be under the application of a diuretic medicine on their head for three or four nights, according to what you require and the patient's age and their usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and make that servant stand between your servants on a lowered bench, and place his servants on his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the tip of your palm near the nose between his ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when your indicated middle location has been reached, mark that place with desire, and then ignite the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the marked desired location, in such a way that it descends, with your hand being gradually constrained, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the spot, and if you see any part of the brain being exposed to some extent, like the quantity of oil, then raise your hand. If it doesn't show anything, turn your hand towards that iron, or another one, if it's cold, in which I've told you to look for what I said.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve that over the spot, and let it sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place on his burnt cheek in bandages, and let it sit until the skin of the heat has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with turpentine tetrabromide until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they used to say that when the wound in Roman times was opened, it smelled much better because it is better and more rejuvenating.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they would say some of them that the canal is cauteryed in the skull, and that you should keep the cautery until a part of the specificity of the skull becomes hard.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then make this mark which sticks to the skull, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they would say others that when the cautery reaches the end, it begins to strengthen in the skull until the skull breaks away, and this is the form of small cautery:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And from that place, they estimate the escape of the steam from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be open for a long time, and then let it heal until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura. De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the removal of old migraines.

e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called the lock pick, because it forms like a thorn in which there is some curvature; in its middle part of it is a small prominence.

Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Cautery for the softening of eyelid swellings in patients.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the patient is swollen due to illness or moisture, then that eyelid is cauterized with a cautery; and this is how it is done:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do the cauterization above both eyebrows with a small to two cauteries across entirely, and make them long on the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery correspond to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to how much of the eyelid is heated.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Cautery of the eyelid in patients when the skin turns into divisions inside and on the hand of the patient.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the patient turns into divisions inside such that I touch the skin, two methods are used for the cautery: either as a physical cautery or with a medicinal burning agent.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If it is a physical cautery with fire, instruct the patient facing this so that they feel their skin as if those who cleanse them, until they are extended and equalized; and if you touch it, then when you place your hand on their birthplace, then you strengthen the skin of the patient with a bandage to prevent burning until the hair is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once they are born and equalized, then place the head of the patient on your own side, and press about the eyelid of the patients with your hand, marking it in a symbol as if it were a holly leaf shape, and make the mark near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place butterfat or pus from hog or from pustule on the skin.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the heat of the cautery, such is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then gradually cauterize over the figure that was marked, little by little, in spots burned out, while burning the surface of the skin which is like a holly leaf, altogether visibly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health in the treatment is that you see the eyelid of the patient already contracted and the skin of it being raised above the point on the skin.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave that for three days, and press it gently with the palm while the scab is being formed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	And if any cause returns through the skin near its birthplace and the eyelid becomes swollen, then do another treatment of cautery over that entire area as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	And if the skin is left on the eyelid, then cauterize that until it rises to its natural place and becomes equal, so that the skin does not hurt the face.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And the cauterization with a burning medicine is that you command the patient to feel their skin until it is extended and equalized, then have a piece of cloth made in the shape of a holly leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some familiar soap and a live onion. .1., Take this preparation and mix those ingredients well, do so quickly to prevent cooling down; then spread it on the cloth made in such a way as if it were a holly leaf shape, place that over one or both of the eyelids; press with butterfat from hog or in its place, and keep the head of the patient facing your side.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place that with the medicine on it and press slightly on it but do not burn the patient when they feel the pain of the medicine, which is like being burned for them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when they continue to feel this pain, then remove the medicine and take it off your designated spot; once the pain stops, then reapply the medicine with water on the eyelid; and then consider if the eyelid has already lifted as if it was cleaned by fire or incision, which is when you do that here; and if it does not return to that place under the medicine on the location where they did not apply the medicine and does not worsen until your operation is equalized and the eyelid is contracted again.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then press it gently with the palm while waiting for the scab from adjustment to be eradicated, and cure that with definitive ointment or otherwise until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to maintain vigilance in your operation that the medicine does not spill over on the skin of the patient, and if the eyelid is somewhat days swollen and some cause from the hair touches the eyelid, then apply your medicine to that place which is swelled by the eyelid, and do so properly as initially instructed, and press gently around it until it heals.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a holly leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men's eyelids are differentiated according to size and thinness, therefore according to this you do your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let there be no concealment of the path of justice towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Regarding cautery treatment for a fistula that occurs in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat the fistula as we have discussed in the divisions of illness and do not provide your cure, then instruct that you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place their head facing your side, and have someone attendant's head between yours so they are neither burnt nor agitated by their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place a point on fat in butter or in flour on the skin of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And here is how the shape of this type of cautery should be made:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be cylindrical, as the shape of a cane or a goose quill is, with one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it penetrates into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to be out like a thread.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, for the purpose of work, that which is cylindrical is better in Gaul.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if there is an opening, press it to allow the healing and dry out that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it's not open, then make an incision there and remove the pus from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place on him the hot cautery, have your hand in Gaul but a little of the cautery at the nostril opening, so that your hand doesn't move or disturb the patient, then pause the cautery in the gray area and destroy it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And indeed, if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the mouth, it's good; and otherwise, then reapply the cautery once or twice if necessary; and let that be for three days, then place a point on that area with oil around it so that dried ointment is between where it is to heal.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has been more than ten days and is not healed, then apply the sharp corrosive medicine inside where the bone is revealed and scrape according to what suits in its skull.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way to apply a cautery to a fistula which some initially described: locate the place of the fistula and make an incision there and press that point with a thin material in the form of it; put one unit of melted lead in that area; hold your hand firmly without causing pain to the patient so that the melted lead does not enter his nose; and when you apply it over the nasal passage, like a point on fat or water, when the lead covers the site of the fistula and heals it through miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have described with this about cautery and healing, it's good; and otherwise, then it's necessary to administer a nostril scrape and reduce the fistula to the chest of the nose according to its proper location.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Regarding the cautery for a cut on the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Red spots may occur in cuts, especially on children's lips.

Capitol .xix.	Capítulo XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Regarding the cautery for a sinus in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When there is pus in the uvula or on the palate or in the root of the teeth, causing swelling, when it breaks open and heals over time, forming a sinus, and if you treat that without going too deep into healing, then determine the amount of heat required for the cautery based on what is inside the sinus, place the heated tool at the opening of the sinus, have your hand so that the heated tip reaches to the base of it, and do this once or twice; then treat it as we have described with healing treatments until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the healing has been removed and it has healed, it's good; and otherwise, then it is necessary to discover the location and remove the diseased bone according to what suits in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Capítulo XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Regarding the application of cautery to teeth and soothing of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and teeth are painful, treat those with medicines but do not apply them directly. Then hold the head of the patient in their usual position and place the heated cautery tool accordingly nearby. You should pause when you press against a tooth and immediately introduce the hot cautery tool into that area to prevent the heat from reaching the tooth's root.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery for several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then have the patient drink water from a salt bowl and keep that there for an hour, and afterwards let it out. This way, hardened teeth are softened, inflamed gums are made less inflamed, and excessive moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	About the application of a cautery to toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Applying the cautery to the surface means you take cow's tallow and heat it in a pot. Then prepare some wick and cover its end with this substance, dip that covered end into the heated tallow, and then hold that over the painful tooth as quickly as possible until it gets cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then apply this process several times so that the heat of the flame reaches to the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent. Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when using a flame for cautery, you should wait until there's a small ember or at the heart of the iron, and make sure that the heat of the flame does not reach into the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then light the cautery in such a way that its heat will come to resemble what you want, hold it over the tooth while keeping your hand there until the heat of the cautery cools down; and do this several times so that the pain is somewhat relieved either on the same day or the following day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri. E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery to whatever end you see fit according to what's feasible for you.

E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will explain the healing of ruptures in other parts of the belly, at meals, and you must not let it heal on its own. Instead, cauterize that rupture with a pointed cautery according to the patient's quantity, so that as much as is expelled from the body should be treated like another part of it; and treat that which we have discussed accordingly, do not adjust it.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And already say some first that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is done with effort:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a line is made across the width at more than half of the rupture, and another line above it; and place your hand on a triangular cautery, where the first cautery is softer and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On cauterization of torsion.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When persistent pain occurs in certain limbs due to impact or percussion and the pain persists for a long time without responding to medicines, then make sure to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And adjust the cauterization for each member according to its size and thickness, its effectiveness and development, as well as the location of the twist and pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	So if it is healed by the first cautery, that's good; and otherwise, then iterate on this member with cauterization; for usually when such pains occur, they puncture parts of the body corresponding to that part closest to the patient, so make sure to use these types of cauterization until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter LVII.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On cauterization for leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some ulcers on the skin are treated with cauterization due to strong youth, and more so if it is a type of leprosy caused by the putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And when you want to cauterize that, consider whether the leprosy is spreading and if it has healed according to what we said in the division of treatment and did not worsen or remain unchanged. If you are worried about the corruption spreading throughout the patient's body and his entire appearance, then cauterize that on top of the head using this method: one near the center of the head, and the second a little further down from there, place the forehead at the end of the hairline; and both over two horns; and one behind, on the back or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And with your hand using this cautery for a little while, let her begin to make an impression in the mouth, and if she has been shifted, so that her expiration of thick vapors is relieved, then cauterize on the pus according to what is needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if leprosy has already spread across the patient's body and is manifestly present, then make sure to cauterize that using these types of cauterizations as we have said for the head; apply cauterization on the end of the nose, and two cauterizations on each cheekbone, and two cauterizations on each collar bone, and five cauterizations on the backbones, and a large one on the lower back, and one on the waistline, and two on the shoulders, and one on each shoulder blade, and two on each hip bone and one on each hip bone, and two on each knee, and two on each muscle; cauterize that over all joints of those mentioned as well as the feet, and over each heel of his feet, and over all his scars.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful not to damage the nerves that are on the base when you do this.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And some ulcers are cauterized with a single cautery on the sinus bone and another in the stomach mouth, and another on the gallbladder.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more finely you adjust the cauterizations, the more quickly and effectively they heal; and know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, like with their ears, because their body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And make sure that the cauterizations are large or small according to the limbs and joints as described by the types of tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And afterwards, treat the cauterization with corn flour mixed with honey and the other treatments until it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter LVIII.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for numbness.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is paralyzed or numb and has been treated with medicines and bandages but does not heal, then you should cauterize the paralyzed limb using cauterizations according to whether it merits the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter a little into the thickening of the flesh.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And afterwards treat it with ointment until it heals.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And some ulcers are treated by cauterizing a numbness which affects the feet and backbones and the muscles of the body, and enhances the numbness.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not judge this matter without one who is knowledgeable about the anatomy of the limbs and the exit of nerves throughout the moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the treatment of warts that are caused by a fever.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When warts are old and do not respond to any of the remedies in medicine, then you cauterize over that with a cautery for as long as there is a noticeable change in the whiteness and color within the wart until the color of the skin changes.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with flour from beeswax and lentils cooked in oil and with leaves of arnagrosa, or with a decoction of doves or apricots, each taken separately and all mixed together. And cover a linen cloth with this mixture and place it over the affected area until complete healing occurs.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the treatment of warts.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When warts begin to appear and you want them to stop, then cauterize that with a round circle of the cautery in the course of its movement around it.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And it is said by the wise that you should cauterize with the tip of the cautery in the middle place; however, I do not see this, fearing that it might be an ulceration, and I have already seen some cases like this.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And the pus is treated by cauterizing in a circular motion around it as we have said, or with a solid cautery.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the treatment of ulcers.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some ulcers are delayed in maturation, and this is due to excess or because of the patient's old age and decay, having few wounds, or due to time, and you want to hasten the maturation of ulcers; then cauterize with a solid cautery circling around it; and then let that which would speed up its maturation take effect.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you want the perforation of it with a cautery, then heat the form of the cautery like this: and place that in the middle part of the ulcer until the needle penetrates.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the treatment of corroding (which could refer to a condition or medical issue causing corrosion, possibly related to skin irritation or damage).
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is the spreading decay in the member, which decays that as wood would burn when fed with dry fuel.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	So if you see that corrosion in the place which suffers from it, then heat solid cauteries as needles and large ones according to what is suitable for that place where it corrodes.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize the entire area until you eliminate all the corrosion and do not damage any part of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let that area rest for three days, and place over the cauterized spots a paste of oil mixed until all the scabs have been eliminated and all the corrosion has been eradicated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat it with meat healing ointments.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	If after approximately three days the healthy flesh grows in the place where there was corrosion, that is good; but if not, then repeat the cauterization over what is decayed in those corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	Corrosion is treated with some doses of acute medicine, which is half in the place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, the cautery with fire is for a small amount of pus that has just begun to appear.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already mentioned the treatment with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you feel it necessary for it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the treatment of warts and other similar conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Visible marks on the parts you have of malaise that are called warts, it's a big cause, it enters and affects the skin; and in those, cauterization is done according to two methods, one with fire and the other with boiled water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Cauterization with fire is to ignite the cautery like a small coal of wood, which must be made of iron according to the quantity that contains the wart in its entirety, and it should have thin edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place the burning on the wart, and then rotate your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the wart until the cautery penetrates to the depth of the wart.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let that rest for three days until you start to feel relief in your arm.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then cover that with salted mussels mixed with salt, and let the bandage stay on that for a night, as it will be eliminated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with meat healing ointment until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and visible marks occur on the surface of the body, especially on the breasts and feet, then you should perform cauterization with water in those places. And take a small tube or iron, or a small coal of wood, place that over the wart; and pour into the tube a little amount of boiling water, move your hand, and turn it around with the pressure of your hand on all sides, pressing the edge of the tube against the root of the wart, allowing the hot water to flow through the root of the cauterization. And wait for the patient an hour while they taste the hot water, then remove that, as the wart will be eradicated from its roots.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus perform those tasks, and bring another close to you from among all those that are within them in their bodies.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And treat those abscesses, for the pustules from the boils have been removed by this means of application where the flesh generates.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the topic of the treatment with a cautery for tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When treating a tremor due to injury of the nerves or fever caused by friction, or due to any other similar cause, then you should apply the cautery at four points or on each rib; and place one cautery on each rib; and another on their feet, and above their stomach, use an olive oil cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of the patient subsides, and quickens the healing process of the illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the treatment with a cautery for chest accidents.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When there are pustules and channels in the body, which are formed of thick corrupted substances; then from the beginning when they appear, you should apply the cautery to every head of the fistula with a fine-pointed rod, the tip of which is extended towards the fire; or with long zizyphus twigs; or with a lentil-shaped cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.
