Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of shoulder joint dislocation.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens to any of the shoulder or neck joints in a complete dislocation, and we reinforce the muscles around that location, then there is no treatment for this, as death occurs to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And as a sign of this, is that the digestion of the patient goes outside against his will, and he cannot hold it; several times, soften some limbs or both sides of him or his arms, or one of those. Or reinforce a muscle in its place, and several times strengthen that and make removals of these to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	And once it's been strengthened behind those parts, it is named gelsemiotismus.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The treatment of it is that you should then consider if gelsemiotismus occurs in childhood; and there is no cure for this nor complete healing.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	And for those that occur due to trauma or impact or similar in those cases, the ancients have said that they discuss treatment with overly long speeches, of which this returns to profitability; but I have abbreviated from that on account of my closeness to your understanding and exposition, to which I have laid out and structured this using various tools from which I will show you this and expand upon that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And say that when jelly-like substance occurs in the feet from the front part, it is neither an illness nor cure for that; similarly, when it happens on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, only that which occurs in the feet specifically under this is cured, as I have prescribed.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient lie on his face on a hard surface about as close to the wall as possible, and let him spread himself out completely wetting it so that he doesn't slip on the feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And put a straight staff upright, placed in the ground at the end of the bed near the head of the patient, and another stick at the other end of the bed under the feet of the patient.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the attendant holds the staff, and does not fix it in a hole; and another attendant holds the other according to that manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And wrap around the head of the patient and make the ligaments tight; extend the end of the ligament to the staff which should be under his head, and tie that on him; and strengthen the other band on the buttocks and knees of the patient, and place those at his back; and adjust all the bands and tie those on the second staff which should be under his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the attendant extends the band to the junction of the staff, and do not have both poles and the bands of their places in which they are placed fixed too tightly, but rather not as tight as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on the spine with strength in which it returns, or he places one on that table, and make him adjust under the table with his feet in which it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	May it be that if it does not return in this way, then take a table whose width or length is about three spans, and dig into the wall as we have said that there is a place for the patient between the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the middle of the table on the spine, and the doctor places his feet at the other end, and he stretches between so that the spine is compressed and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open both sides which are twisted under the hand; and what you should do is put the head of the patient on the ground with his back facing the end of two sticks in front of him, the length of which is about one span. And place his head at the end of the bed on two sticks as well, the distance between them being a span each. And ensure that the length between every stick is about one span, and have it done so that you pull out all sides under the ground so they are not disturbed.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And put another stick to support the side, and it should twist in both turns of each stick.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a turn where the stick forms, whose length is about one span under which it twists; and in the other two sticks it's similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And adjust the bands you've tightened in the feet of the patient under that turn which should be behind his head, and the bands you've tightened on his thighs under that one which should be under his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And for each side, you should have one attendant to twist that side with his hand, and the doctor adjusts the spine according to what we've said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is how the twist works:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And here is how to do it once the spine has returned and the place has been adjusted: take beaten earth mixed with goose fat and stop; then put that on the beaten earth on a table whose width is about three inches or roughly those sizes, and the length should match the size of the jelly-like substance, and over the junction of the spine there.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And next, use the band we have said, let the patient take in subtle nourishment so that they are cured.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains any danger at the end of recovery in the place, then take care to administer medicines that purify and clean during the long period before the table is removed, as we have recommended; and already an antimony leaf has been administered in that place.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes there are dangers at the end of the spine on both sides due to dislocation; and that's the place which has already undergone such danger so that you should not take any precautions for him with this medicine, which would cause his death to occur.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capítulo XXI.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a hernia that has been dislocated.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the pubis and the joint of the muscle should not be subject to dislocation alone, but it does not happen in those places as what happens to other joints with small movement and curvature.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the pubis is dislocated in four ways, which are: it is dislocated internally or externally, or forwardly or backwardly.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is more commonly dislocated internally, with less often occurring externally or behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	A sign of dislocation internally is this: when you adjust the healthy leg on the patient's body, it becomes longer than normal; the thigh is more prominent than that of a healthy person. The patient cannot bend their knee properly and has to hold their leg in a bent position, so that their buttock protrudes here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the one to whom dislocation happens is outside the parts, it's that his accidents are against this incident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the one to whom dislocation happens in front is that when his hernia expands with a fullness, but otherwise does not bend that pain which is during his defecation; and if it continues to increase beyond this dislocation in front; and his urine is retained and his swelling is stopped, you should consider his mobility on the sole.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the one to whom dislocation happens at the rear is that it does not extend his defecation, nor can he bend what bends in front that it bends swelling, and his hernia is much shorter than the other, and his swelling is relieved, and the tip of the thigh is below this location.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The possible reduction of this type of dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and long-lasting, that it has reached this level where you apply the reduction to him according to his position, then not in all; and therefore do not assume any suspicion in that case.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In the case where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four types of dislocation, then you must take this to turn the joint back and extend it towards the inside parts and the outside parts, and move it to the right and left, wherever its natural position returns and there is no need for another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it doesn't return in this manner, then you must prepare to exert force and extend the patient's hernia from its deeper location, or at their chest, or over that which is attached above the hernia; and another assistant should spread his hand upwards towards the buttocks so that he can place their hands under the buttocks. And firmly grip the center of the thigh with your right hand, and have another assistant hold the end of the ligament gently.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if it is extension of him or from the inside towards swelling at the part of the neck, or from the front to the part behind, or from the rear to the second part.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And if it is the extension of all in a single action that the patient should be elevated from his chest to the ground and dangles freely.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common for all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so, if the dislocation returns as we have said, it is good; and otherwise, then for each type of its own treatment, it is necessary.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of your own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is inside, you must have the patient recline on his side; and then place the ligaments over the center of the thigh in that spot which lies between the tip of the thigh and the spot where swelling occurs. And extend the ligament from its lower end towards the farthest part of the neck region to the other part of the neck.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another assistant should firmly grasp his arms, tighten the large area of the thigh below and extend towards the outside parts by vigorous extension, until it returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type requires much less treatment for reducing this member compared to the other types.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	And if you are excused and do not follow the treatment for this type of cure completely, then let both feet of the patient be held at once by strong but gentle hands, on both thighs and both buttocks.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each foot according to the quantity of four fingers, and let the thigh be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And have the patient's thigh hanging on top of the armrest, and upright; and let the length of the ground be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong youth to minimize the tip of the thigh, and have him hang from the patient with another youth, and let the other youth pull the thing with maximum strength until the joint returns to its place at speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	And in the self-reduction, when dislocation is outside the part, it's that you should push the thigh forward according to what we have recommended during the preparation; and strengthen the ligament over the thigh properly and over its feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And have two armrests placed, one under the patient's foot, and the other on top; and have two armrests adjusted in the middle of the buttocks covered with damp cloth, so that the thigh is not wet by the armrest being between his thighs; for you should extend the arms to the outside parts without it being pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each assistant should spread out according to his own part, the doctor with his hand manages the reduction according to art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So, if you follow the reversal, it will be greatly beneficial; and otherwise, pause on that diligently and do it as we said during preparation for that adjustment.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And have the patient lie down on his side calmly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the parts in front, then let the thigh be extended slightly, and as per this medium account about the body; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the patient's lower thigh, and applies force with his other hand, and through that pressure he holds it while extending to the outside parts leaving the part of the rear.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is behind the parts, then it's necessary that the patient be laid on their back and elevated above the ground; also, they should be placed on a hard surface so that their abdomen protrudes due to dislocation when their width is dislocated outwardly, as we explained about laying them on two widths; and they are on their face and ribs extend, according to what we said, almost without error.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it's necessary that compression be applied onto the table over the area where the joint is protruding.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, once the reduction is completed as specified - and you don't see any sign of reduction in them, meaning that you should extend their thighs, then when you equalize those movements and they straighten their leg by extending their thigh and spreading out their foot, if you know how to move according to what has been reduced - then you adjust the two parts and apply poultice, stretching it over the body so that no part is neglected; and secure the patient in bed for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then gently massage the muscle and poultice, and compare one leg against the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And when you see that they are equal in appearance, then you know that the dislocation has been corrected, and then let the leg go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of relaxation, then return and treat that area with a poultice, stretch it according to your initial position, and let it rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then gently move that area, making the patient walk on both legs for several days until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder can be dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated outwardly from the parts, inwardly towards the parts, and outwardly more to the parts behind. It is not dislocated forward of the parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of shoulder dislocation is when you command the leg to apply its thigh against the hip; then you know that the shoulder has been dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is that you make the leg straighten outwardly, so that it can extend its thigh if possible on this; attach your two hands to their face and place your foot between your hands; then place the shoulder against your palms, hold them together with strength over the dislocated shoulder, and another serves to extend their leg when the shoulder returns to its position.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The sign of successful restoration is when their thigh sticks to the hip and remains comfortably elevated.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply a poultice and make the thigh stick to the hip, and repeatedly adjust those areas for three or four days on one part, and then gently massage them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the leg to walk for a few days, until it is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	And if the reduction of your leg is justified, then apply strong extension to the muscles as described in the preceding narrative about hip treatment.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of shoulder joint dislocation.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The shoulder joint can sometimes be displaced due to minor trauma, and in other instances it occurs with the full range of motion. The displacement can happen inwardly towards the parts or outwardly away from them.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of shoulder joint displacement is that you move your arm outwardly towards the part where it has been displaced.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment for correcting minor displacements is relatively easy and involves extending the arm with ease towards the body, making sure that it becomes equal in position until it returns to its correct location.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In treating when it is displaced with the full range of motion, you should make the leg straight and have one assistant hold firmly and strongly from behind the leg at its midsection.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then place your right hand on the back of the upper leg, and with your left hand at the lower part of the leg near the knee.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the leg towards you with your right hand, and with your left hand across two points, and also extend it with your left. And push the feet of the leg from the right under the thigh as far as possible.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do these two points as we have discussed.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the feet towards the thigh along the third point, and you are at the knee.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	If you return in one way or two according to this manner, and if the pain is equal on both sides, it's good; and otherwise, then modify the operation, until it works when he returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If you are prohibited from returning him as we have advised, then have the patient lie on their back on the ground, and place a thick cloth under them, and put it between their thighs. Then wrap a sheet around the patient to prevent the hernia from slipping down.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And direct the minister to hold his thighs, and another minister to extend his feet either over or under the chest; and extend each minister against the extension of their side, and the cloth should remain between the thighs of the patient while holding him, so that the body does not slip towards the sides beyond its own extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And direct the doctor to reposition the joint near their own feet, while another minister holds the healthy thigh in place, so that the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you have been informed about his health in the return, then stop with plastering and strengthen that firmly, and place the foot under tension against the chest.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And when you fear or protect from the nerves that are behind over the heel, so that the muscle on it is not vigorous and injures him strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And direct him to rest for two or three days; and if the muscle has softened, extend it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And on the third day or fourth day, have him loosen up, and prohibit the patient from walking for another ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	If it is forced to go in front of that space, there's not enough security that the dislocation will not dissolve and decay on him, and what does not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens that he gets a carbuncle, then remember in the distribution of his treatment what we have explained in our narrative, in another place of healing and application, until it is cured.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Capital: 34
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Regarding the treatment of dislocation in the fingers of the foot.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Make sure that the one who is dislocated has slightly extended his treatment area; and what is not difficult, in advance it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in one of the joints of the foot, then make sure that you have the patient lie on their foot over a similar location on the ground or on a table, and stay like they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And direct you to stand on your foot, and place your hand over the area where you are touching the joints, and directly push it against your foot with force so that it returns, and see that it is already aligned and does not appear in the touched area.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And direct you to place the belly of your foot on a table that accommodates your whole foot, which has two ends, and direct you to strengthen it with proper structure and strength for three days; and direct him to loosen up and have rest from walking for a few more days, until it is strengthened and its functionality is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Capital: 35
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Regarding the different types of dislocation that can occur on a joint or fracture, or at any time.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of those happens, and you apply yourself to its treatment and restoring him, many deaths succeed it.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And so do not presume on his treatment, but the one who is skilled in that art, with long use, merciful and compassionate; be late, not impulsive or presumptuous; he should use only medicines that can cure carbuncles alone, and leave the patient to divine judgment, rather than to anyone you hope for salvation from disaster, towards alleviation of illness, and in which you have any hopes.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then strive to immediately make the reduction for him during the onset of treatment, before a carbuncle appears.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then, if the limb returns as we want, then administer treatment that can cure carbuncles and treat the injury with what suits him from the dry ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation occurs with a fracture and it happens in the separated bones, then you perform their setting, and do what we have said about treating simple injuries of that which was followed up on those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And follow and avoid according to your skill the interior of the medicine in the ways of fear as you have been guided by my preaching; what is better for you is to trust your Creator, more permanent to your glory, and more health for your true self will be seen those in your own time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	And thus conclude the words of Al-Bu'ardi, perfectly from which God may not be praised enough.
Amen.	Amen.
